agenda.description: ** REVISION ** HOUSE OF REPRESENTATIVES NOTICE OF PUBLIC HEARING COMMITTEE: Public Education TIME & DATE: 8:00 AM, Tuesday, April 23, 2019 PLACE: E2.036 CHAIR: Rep. Dan Huberty *The order in which bills are heard is at the discretion of the chair* *Testimony will be limited to two (2) minutes* HB 142 Moody Relating to a notice of educational rights and recovery by school districts and open-enrollment charter schools of costs for certain student evaluations. HB 535 Neave Relating to completion and submission of a financial aid application for costs of higher education as a condition of high school graduation for public school students. HB 727 González, Mary | et al. Relating to the use of public school counselors' work time. HB 1763 Blanco | et al. Relating to the eligibility of the children of public school educators for free prekindergarten programs in public schools. HB 2217 Raymond Relating to consideration by the board of trustees of a school district of parental complaints regarding student or parent participation in an extracurricular activity. HB 2526 Leach Relating to criteria for admission of certain students into public schools. HB 3005 Talarico Relating to college preparatory courses for public high school students. HB 3025 Talarico Relating to certain procedures regarding a dispute relating to special education services provided by a school district or open-enrollment charter school. HB 3026 Talarico | et al. Relating to the assignment of certain behavioral health professionals to a public school campus. HB 3153 Raymond Relating to the applicability of nepotism prohibitions to the appointment or employment of certain classroom teachers by school districts. HB 3179 Stucky Relating to costs associated with the statewide assessment program of public school students. HB 3316 White Relating to the Texas Crime Stoppers Council. HB 3344 Bucy Relating to requiring fine arts as part of the foundation curriculum for public schools. HB 3452 Dutton Relating to evaluating the performance of dropout recovery schools for purposes of the public school accountability system. HB 3489 Cole Relating to the establishment of a task force on sex-based harassment in public schools. HB 3623 Schaefer Relating to renewal of a public school teacher's continuing employment contract based on student growth. HB 3651 Davis, Yvonne Relating to a study and report regarding school district size and school district cost and academic effectiveness. HB 3851 Lang Relating to unfunded state educational mandates imposed on school districts. HB 3880 Wilson Relating to information provided to public school students regarding the use of anabolic steroids. HB 3888 Ramos Relating to a school district's plan for parental involvement concerning mental health and substance use issues and suicide prevention. HB 4030 Dominguez Relating to funding for school districts to provide inclusive and accessible playgrounds. HB 4094 Beckley Relating to school district grace period policies and the provision of meals to public school students with insufficient balances on prepaid meal cards or meal accounts. HB 4186 Sanford Relating to the creation of a committee to recommend a framework to incorporate digital teaching and learning in public schools. HB 4302 VanDeaver Relating to regulations authorizing special education hearing officer subpoenas. HB 4313 Dominguez Relating to the creation of an adaptive sports program by the University Interscholastic League to provide students with disabilities access to team sports. HB 4324 VanDeaver Relating to the submission and use of electronic student records in the electronic student records system. HB 4383 Bohac Relating to a reporting requirement for public schools regarding instructional materials and technology. HB 4414 Allison Relating to identification and development of mental health resources for students. HB 4578 Gervin-Hawkins Relating to the inclusion of instruction regarding culturally inclusive curriculum reflecting the cultural, linguistic and religious diversity of society. HB 4589 Anchia Relating to the provision of a quality and globally competitive education as a mission of the public education system. HJR 150 Anchia Proposing a constitutional amendment requiring the system of public free schools to be globally competitive. Bills deleted after last posting: HB 2981 ** See Committee Coordinator for previous versions ** of the schedule, if applicable. NOTICE OF ASSISTANCE AT PUBLIC MEETINGS Persons with disabilities who plan to attend this meeting and who may need assistance, such as a sign language interpreter, are requested to contact Stacey Nicchio at (512) 463-0850, 72 hours prior to the meeting so that appropriate arrangements can be made.
